Explanation: Applying \\( g(t, x) \\) modifies the input function, thus changing the initial conditions of the transformation. The matrix exponential \\( e^{Bt} \\) potentially alters the nature of \\( x(t) \\) contributing to different results in the transformed output \\( y(T) \\) due to variation in integration with respect to the modified input.
